# General overview

## Introduction
This books provides a consise overview of biostatistics and its applications using the R programming language.  The textbook *Fundamentals of Biostatitics* [@Rosner2016] was used extensivity in the preparation of this book.

## Example dataset
Examples of R functions are performed on a dataset of patients with newly diagnosed multiple myeloma.  This dataset  contains a variety of categorical and continuous variables (Table 1). 

```{r echo=FALSE}
library(knitr)
library(kableExtra)
load("docs/Example-data.Rda")
kable(data)%>%
  kable_styling(bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover", "condensed", "responsive", "bordered"), font_size = 12) %>%
  scroll_box(width = "100%", height = "100%") %>%
  footnote(general = "Example dataset", general_title = "Table 1", title_format = "italic")
```
